location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government at Bombay Castle, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government at Bombay Castle, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, on the Joasimese [Qasimi] Piratical fleet on the coast North of Bombay.In enclosure:copy of letter from Francis Warden to H Merton, Superintendent of the Marine dated 30 November 1813, informing that the East India Company cruisers Benaresand Prince of Walesare to be kept in the Persian Gulf for protection of the trade unless the Resident at Bushire should find necessary to send them to Bombay;copy of letter sent from C W Elwood, Agent to Government at Poor Bunder [Porbandar, India] to Francis Warden, dated 25 November, informing that five merchant boat sailing were taken by a fleet of eleven Joasimese Pirates consisting of seven dows and four bottillas.
